alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 8:36AM CDT until August 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Birmingham AL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Heavy rainfall of near 5 inches has occurred since midnight over the Sucarnoochee River basin and a flood warning is now in effect for the Sucarnoochee River. Another statement will be issued by this evening, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO EARLY SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River At Livingston. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to early Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21 feet, Overflow of low-lying agricultural lands increases. Cattle and farm equipment should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 20.6 feet Friday evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
